text: Idaho Legislative District 26 is one of 35 districts of the Idaho Legislature. It is currently represented by Senator Michelle Stennett, Democrat of Ketchum, Representative Steve Miller, Republican of Fairfield, and Representative Sally Toone, Democrat of Gooding. == District profile (2012–present) == District 26 currently consists of all of Blaine, Camas, Gooding, and Lincoln Counties. {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |- | Legislature || Session ||Senate || House Seat A || House Seat B |- | rowspan="2" colspan="1" style="text- align: center;" |62nd (2012 - 2014) | 1st | rowspan="8" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |Michelle Stennett (D) | rowspan="6" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |Steve Miller (R) | rowspan="4" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |Donna Pence (D) |- | 2nd |- | rowspan="2" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |63rd (2014 - 2016) | 1st |- | 2nd |- | rowspan="2" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |64th (2016 - 2018) | 1st | rowspan="4" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |Sally Toone (D) |- | 2nd |- | rowspan="2" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |65th (2018 - 2020) | 1st | rowspan="2" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |Marianna Davis (D) |- | 2nd |} == District profile (2002–2012) == From 2002 to 2012, District 26 consisted of all of Minidoka and Jerome Counties. {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |- | Legislature || Session ||Senate || House Seat A || House Seat B |- | rowspan="2" colspan="1" style="text- align: center;" |57th (2002 - 2012) | 1st |- | 2nd |} == District profile (1992–2002) == From 1992 to 2002, District 26 consisted of all of Clark, Custer, Jefferson, and Lemhi Counties. {| class=wikitable style="text-align:center" |- | Legislature || Session ||Senate || House Seat A || House Seat B |- | rowspan="2" colspan="1" style="text-align: center;" |51st (1992 -
